subject: Re: unknows AssertError and feature request
msgSnippet: Hello, thanks for these answers. I see my English got worse. May some lines of code say more than thousand words. I never used JUnit before. I don t know
messageBody:
Hello,

thanks for these answers. I see my English got worse.

May some lines of code say more than thousand words.
I never used JUnit before. I don't know something about JUnit-3. I
started with current version 4.1.

My testing class is build like that (pseudo class):

@RunWith(Parameterized.class)
public class Test {

File file;

@Parameters public static Collection collectConfig() {

File directory = new File("");
// get all files in all subdirs
List<File> allFiles = findAllFile(directory);
// dirty but it works
File[][] out = new File[allFiles.size()][1];
for (int i = 0; i < list.size(); i++) {
out[i][0] = list.get(i);
}

return Arrays.asList(out);
}

@Test public void test() {
// some tests
}

@Test public void moreTesting() {
// some more tests
}

public Test(File f) {
this.file = f;
}
}

What happens in this class:
- first of all the @Parameters-methode will be evaliated
- for every item in the collection a new class will be created
- every class runs the two @Test-methodes

This runs fine. For every file I found (findAllFile(File)) there are
two testing methodes. But in this case I have an output of JUnit in
Eclipse without the current parameter. There is just something like that:
- Test
[0]
test[0]
moreTesting[0]
[1]
test[1]
moreTesting[1]
[2]
test[2]
moreTesting[2]
...
[i]
test[i]
moreTesting[i]

If there is an error in one test methode, the methode will be marked,
but there is no reference for the current file in the current test run.

Hopefully I was able to write what I want to say.

Ciao, scherzartikel_gottes
